The away team tries to prevail using combination football.

    #######TASK 
    Provide a factually correct and detailed textual description of the game compiled from the information presented above from different sources, in more than 1000 words.
            "Cap:": represents the captions published in the online portal usually within 30 seconds of the event.
            "E:" represents events recorded exactly after the event happened.
    Don't mention sources of information like commentators or captions, write as if you saw them live.
summary:
In a highly anticipated La Liga clash, Real Madrid delivered an emphatic performance against Espanyol, defeating the hosts 6-0 at RCDE Stadium. The match provided a wealth of thrilling action from kickoff to the final whistle, reflecting Real Madrid's dominance and clinical finishing.

The game commenced with Espanyol kicking off. Within the first minute, the home side showed their attacking intent with a shot on target, forcing the ball out of play almost immediately thereafter. Espanyol earned themselves a couple of corners but failed to capitalize on these early opportunities. Real Madrid, facing the initial pressure, responded with composure. By the third minute, they had their own chance, though it went off target.

Real Madrid quickly found their rhythm, and it paid off in the seventh minute. After a throw-in by Real, they executed a quick sequence of plays that culminated in a goal by their talismanic forward. An accurate shot on target saw Real Madrid take the lead, injecting confidence into their ranks.

The trend of the game’s physical nature was evident early on, with multiple fouls committed by Espanyol, leading to several indirect free-kicks for Real Madrid. The physical tussles were equally matched by tactical fouls from Real Madrid as they sought to maintain their slender lead.

However, things worsened for Espanyol in the 16th minute when Real Madrid was awarded a penalty following a foul inside the box. The responsibility fell to Cristiano Ronaldo, who securely buried the ball into the bottom-right corner, doubling Real Madrid’s lead. The Espanyol defenders struggled to contain Real Madrid's relentless attacking play, with Ronaldo increasingly proving to be a nightmare for the defense.

Midway through the first half, Real Madrid's midfield maestro Luka Modric showcased his playmaking abilities, splitting the Espanyol defense with incisive passes, while the likes of Gareth Bale and Karim Benzema kept the pressure up front. Despite Espanyol's attempts to respond, their efforts lacked precision, with several shots missing the target or being effectively neutralized by Keylor Navas in goal.

Espanyol's defensive frailties were further exposed in the 28th minute when Ronaldo once again found the back of the net. A cross from Gareth Bale was deftly converted by Ronaldo, making it 3-0. The constant surges from Real Madrid seemed too much for the Espanyol defense, and they were soon punished again. A lightning-quick interplay saw Cristiano Ronaldo turn provider, assisting Karim Benzema to extend the lead to 4-0.

Despite the heavy scoreline, Espanyol's resilience saw them muster a few attempts themselves. Salva Sevilla had a notable shot saved by Navas, who remained alert and decisive in goal. However, these moments were sparse for the home side, who spent most of the half fighting off Real Madrid's dominant displays.

The first half concluded with Real Madrid firmly in the driver's seat, leading 4-0. The interval did little to change the dynamics of the match as Real Madrid resumed their dominance immediately in the second half. Espanyol made two substitutions, bringing on Jose Canas and Paco Montanes to rejuvenate their lineup. The changes, however, failed to turn the tide.

Cristiano Ronaldo completed his hat trick in the 58th minute, showcasing his unparalleled finishing abilities. Gareth Bale's low pass into the box found Ronaldo in space, who made no mistake with his effort, slotting in from close range to bring the score to 5-0.

Real Madrid, in full control, continued to pile on the pressure. The midfield was controlled expertly by Isco, who replaced Luka Modric just outside the hour mark. Isco's creativity and vision ensured that Real's attack maintained its tempo and unpredictability.

Espanyol fought to salvage some pride, managing a few attempts which either missed the mark or were deftly blocked by Real's defense. Gerard Moreno and Felipe Caicedo had notable efforts but were ultimately thwarted by Navas and company.

In the 82nd minute, Real Madrid added their final flourish to an already impressive performance. Amidst a rapid counter-attack orchestrated by Isco, Ronaldo latched onto a superb through pass to notch his fourth goal, emblematic of his predatory prowess.

As the game drew to a close, the frustrations for Espanyol were apparent. Several more fouls and yellow cards disrupted any flow they tried to establish. Real Madrid, showing professional composure, played out the remaining minutes with controlled possession, ensuring Espanyol had little opportunity to make any meaningful inroads.

The final whistle echoed the comprehensive nature of the victory. Real Madrid showcased their superiority and tactical discipline throughout the match, delineating the vast gap between the two sides. Espanyol's best efforts were insufficient against a Real Madrid team that capitalized on almost every opportunity with lethal precision.

Espanyol's manager will have much to contemplate, particularly their defensive organization and inability to cope with the fluidity of Real's attack. For Real Madrid, this match was a testament to their attacking efficiency, defensive solidity, and the indispensable talent of Cristiano Ronaldo.

With this victory, Real Madrid secured crucial points to remain well-positioned in La Liga's upper echelons, sending a clear message to their rivals. The performance also notably boosts morale ahead of upcoming fixtures, emphasizing their potential for both domestic and European campaigns.

The enthusiastic Espanyol crowd, despite witnessing their team suffer a heavy defeat, remained spirited and supportive, showcasing the vibrant football culture that defines La Liga. Such a captivating match, revelatory of Real Madrid's strengths and Espanyol's areas for improvement, will be remembered by the fans and serve as an educational experience for both teams as they advance through the season.
